data.meta_description: St. Georgeâs by the River Episcopal Church Rumson, New Jersey Historic Trust, Garden State Historic Preservation Trust Fund
data.text:
St. George’s By the River is architecturally significant for its representation of a Gothic Revival style Church executed in the style of a rural English parish church, a design advocated by Anglican reformers in the mid 19th century. Organized by families who owned summer homes in Rumson when still a resort town, the church is also significant in the area of community development.

The 2004 Trust grant helped fund a preservation plan that addressed structural and exterior concerns to guide the church’s restoration.
